basics.summary: Artificial neural networks, evolutionary computation and multi-agent systems that show emergent behavior fascinate me in their ability to come up with surprisingly creative solutions to a broad range of problems. Even when these algorithms fail, they tend to fail in a natural way, making mistakes that can seem eerily human. Apart from having a wide range of practical applications, these models may provide us with insights into human and animal intelligence. I enjoy exploring generative models in an artistic context and integrating multidisciplinary ideas drawing from a variety of fields  such as game theory, computer science, foresight research, generative art, music, signal processing, and computer vision.

publications.name: Evolving a Neural Model of Insect Path Integration
publications.summary: We use a genetic algorithm to evolve a novel neural model of path integration, based on input from cells that encode the heading of the agent in a manner comparable to the polarization-sensitive interneurons found in insects. The home vector is encoded across a circular array of cells that integrate this input. We demonstrate the capabilities of the network under noisy conditions in simulation and on a robot.

As one of the founders of the multidisciplinary art collective Voodoohop, I became deeply involved with the art and music scene of São Paulo and Brazil. Guided by the principle of stimulating individual and joint freedom of expression, Voodoohop is enjoying international success with performances at events all over Europe, the USA, South America and a sold out physical release in Japan.

As a musician, I have created a unique live performance in which software I developed is responsible for generating harmony, melody and modifying the musical arrangements in real time.

work.summary:
Conceived and developed a range of interactive installations using technologies including machine learning, computer vision, distributed computing, controllers, sensors, embedded computing and data visualization.

**Examples:**
. With the help of facial tracking, a microphone and pitch analysis, participants could [paint on a blank canvas](https://vimeo.com/77349535) using their voice and head movements. 
. An OpenGL based climbing game in which [a user climbs a mountain](https://vimeo.com/20260318) using the movement of his own hands 
. For the 2014 FIFA World Cup, using computer vision and real-time image augmentation, participants [took selfies with the official mascot](https://vimeo.com/116658261) superimposed onto the image.
. Visitors of a science museum could draw shapes into different types of simulated sand using a multi-touch screen

Implementation of my thesis [Evolving a Neural Model of Insect Path Integration](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/1059712307082080) on a physical robot and publication in the journal "Adaptive Behavior"
